On Sat, 24 Apr 2004 15:53:20 -0600 (MDT), Clark I Anderson wrote:

>When I try running JUnit from within Eclipse, it tries to access an
>external IP, which I prevent, and it fails:

What IP exactly? Is it by chance the IP of the computer you're
working on? You can find that out with opening a command-shell
and entering "ipconfig" in it. If you block to access your own
computer you should stop working on computers at all and switch
to type-writers ;-)

How do you use junit? Running it inside an ant-process or starting
it in Eclipse as JUnit-Test?

>Could not connect to:  : 5254

Sounds like a port and not an IP.

>java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
[...]
>	at
>org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.connect(RemoteTestRunner.java:547)
>	at
>org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(RemoteTestRunner.java:270)
>	at
>org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner.java:167)


>I do not know why it is trying to use RemoteTestRunner.

Ask the developers of the ant-plugin.


Regards, Lothar
